Module 1: MeL Overview

What is MeL?

The Michigan eLibrary (MeL) is like having a whole library at your fingertips! It's a free service that's available to Michigan residents, thanks to the Library of Michigan, an agency of the Michigan Department of Education, and the support of the Midwest Collaborative of Library Services (MCLS).

With MeL, you can get access to tons of online resources like full-text articles, books, and digital images, all for free and available 24/7.

And if you prefer to get your hands on a physical book, MeL also offers an easy interlibrary loan system that lets you borrow materials from participating libraries across the state.

Select the down arrow on each accordion section below to learn more about MeL.

  • MeL Resources

    MeL Resources provide educators and learners with the following:

    • Content for instruction
    • Content geared toward professional learning
      • Professional journals
      • eBook Academic Collection
    • Built-in accessibility tools
      • Text to speech
      • Translation
      • Double-click dictionary
      • Page masking
      • Text highlighting
    • Cost savings
      • Free magazines
      • Free eBooks
      • Free professional journals
    • Ability to share resources digitally as well as in print
  • Why use MeL

    MeL is a free resource for all citizens in Michigan. It provides content that supports all disciplines in K-12 classrooms. Specifically, the MeL eResources support:

    • Michigan Academic Standards K-12
    • Essential Instructional Practices in Literacy
      • Michigan Integrated Technology Competencies for Students (Knowledge Constructor)
      • Information Literacy
  • How to use MeL

    Where you access MeL resources might make a difference. Public institutions, like schools or a public library, use Direct URLs. However, when trying to access the MeL eResources from home, users must be utilizing a Geo-IP URL and coming from a Michigan IP address.

    • For more information on home access, please visit Geo-IP URL
    • For additional access information, please visit eResources Access Guide

    Accessing MeL eResources

    Once you are on the MeL.org landing page, select the “eResources” tab from the top menu bar to access the eResource launch page. Scroll down the page to locate an A to Z list of the eResources available in MeL for individual resources to open. You can also select the “Educators” tab on the same menu bar to access a list of Geo-IP URLs for all the eResources.
